chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Christopher S Johnson was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years and 10 months bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. DNA surcharge assessed. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, school or vocational training or a combination of the three as determined by the agent.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant must comply will all Family Court and Child Support orders.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Firearm warning given. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

**Defendant is eligible for the Substance abuse program once 75% of the sentence is completed.***

Defendant Christopher S Johnson in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Defendant Christopher S Johnson in custody.  Chris D Steenrod for Matt Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled for Sentencing hearing.
Def is requesting a short adjournment to look into something regarding the PSI.
State does not object.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
***DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING***

Defendant Christopher S Johnson in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Defendant Christopher S Johnson in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - Ct.3 - G.
BTC: Ct.3 - GUILTY.    Ct.1 - Dismissed.   Ct.2 - DRI.
BTC: Deft to be held w/out bond pending sentencing, PSI Ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO REMOVE THE SCRAM UNIT***  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Do not drive at all.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
